intro: Campylanthus benthamii, commonly known as the Bentham's campylanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Campylanthus benthamii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
